question: From which nation Bosnia and Herzegovina gained its independence in 1992?
explanation: From the mid-15th to the late-19th centuries Bosnia and Herzegovina was under the Ottoman Empire. The Ottomans brought Islam to the region. Later it was annexed to Austro-Hungarian monarchy and continued till World War I. And till World War II, it was under the Kingdom of Yugoslavia. After World War II it was annexed to Yugoslavia. In 1992, it was declared independent.
